_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Dry Pasta, Dough, and Flour Mixes Manufacturing from Purchased Flour

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
EXECUTIVE SUMMARY:



1. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policy: TreeHouse Private Brands maintains a

comprehensive safety, health, and environmental program at the plant. The program includes engineering,

education, and enforcement provisions for hazard communication, spill prevention and response, hazardous

waste, universal waste and waste oil management, waste water and storm water management.



2. Emergency Response Program: This TreeHouse Private Brands facility has developed an OSHA hazardous substance

emergency action plan. The plan outlines specific procedures for evacuations, incident alarms and alerting.

Depending upon a given situation, the Fire Department will be called to provide back-up emergency responders

and equipment. The Fire Department will be called for all fire related emergencies. The facility has

communicated hazard of ammonia with the local fire department and LEPC. The incident commander has

ultimate control of implementation of the emergency response plan.



3. Stationary Source and Regulated Substance: TreeHouse Private Brands is a processing plant located at 1905 Country

Club Drive, Carrollton TX. The facility houses a processing plant used for manufacturing, packaging, warehousing and 

shipping of refrigerated products. The products require refrigeration for the processing and storage of these products.



4. Worst Case and Alternative Release Scenarios: RMP*Comp was used to calculate the worst case and

alternative release scenarios for the process.



5. Five Year Accident History: There have been no reportable incidents during the past five years. However,

the facility maintains records of all incident investigation reports regardless of anhydrous ammonia quantity

released into the atmosphere.



6. Planned changes to improve safety: Based on the Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) for anhydrous ammonia,

lists of action items were developed. The status of these action items will be monitored to ensure th

at

implementation of the safety improvements is accomplished. Monthly safety training is conducted for all team

members at this facility, in addition PSM meetings are held to review safety and PSM/RMP program elements. Refer

to Process Safety Management Program for specific information.
